III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility is responsible for ensuring timely medical and dentals even if the
youth does not have insurance or the office utilized is not responding to inquiries.
• The facility needs to ensure the DCWL consultant receives notifications of
incidents as indicated in R 400.4150.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not require consultation at this time.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 4 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
• The first CAP was approved on 9/19/22 to address the findings of the
Renewal Licensing Study completed on 8/10/22. The facility was found in
violation of R 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical
examinations, R 400.4552 Heating devices and flame producing devices,
and a contract violation for Behavioral Health Services. As indicated by
this inspection the facility is in complaince with all violations cited during
the renewal inspection.
• A CAP was approved on 1/20/23 in response to Special Investigation
2023C000007 in which the facility was found in violation of R 400.4116
Chief administrator; responsibilities because the facility was not following
the CAP that was in place to address the Behavior Health Services
citation in the Renewal Inspection. The facility has completed this CAP
and have an on-site therapist to provide services to the youth.
• A CAP was approved on 2/27/23 for Special Investigation 2023C0000156
in which the facility was found in violation of R 400.4158 Intervention
standards and prohibitions because a staff member engaged in verbally
abusive language and gestures with youth. The facility has completed
this CAP.
• A CAP was approved on 5/23/23 in response to Special Investigation
2023C0000338 in which the facility was found in violation of R 400.4158
Intervention standards and prohibitions and R 400.4159 Youth restraint;
pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of
restraints a staff member threw a youth down on the ground in order to
restrain him then had the youth in a prone restraint. The facility is still
working on this CAP and have made progress toward its completion.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
A PREA audit was completed on 3/9/21. The audit indicated 3 areas of
improvement. The PREA policy needed to be updated to include a date the policy
was approved and who would be approving the policy. The staff were not aware
that an investigation needs to be completed for PREA allegations and the youth
were not aware they could access advocacy services. Highfield’s next PREA audit
is to be conducted in 2024.
3

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator indicated the CAP's from last year’s inspection have been
working. The area they continue to struggle with is navigating the acting out
behavior of the youth they are getting while still trying to eliminate restraints. They
have implemented additional trainings to prepare staff to work with the types of
youth they are getting.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The staff interviewed did not have any concerns and were pleased with the
direction the facility has been taking to increase trainings to help them better
support the youth they are caring for.
The three youth interviewed were happy with the program and all of them have
been successful in the program. They did not have any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is currently utilizing two houses. Both houses were clean and well
organized. There were not any safety issues observed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
